title: Froze Toes Road Race
course:
A rolling 31 mile loop with a couple big ring climbs across rural Mid Missouri a true Midwest classic!
http://www.mapmyride.com/routes/view/67774414
registration: Day of Race Registration only  Juniors race for only 10 BUCKS
notes: Same Start finish as Last year hosted by Cedar Creek Homes.
directions:
NEW Directions from Columbia: 
Take I‐70 East approximately seven miles to 
Route Z (exit 133). Go north of I‐70 to first right 
on outer road, parking and start/finish is at 
Cedar Creek Homes, 8949 I‐70 Drive NE. 
We will have indoor changing facilities but 
outdoor porta‐potties for use.

title: The Columbia Bottom Conservation Area Time Trial /
Hellbender Omnium
description: The Rolla Multisport Club is proud to bring you the 2013 Hellbender Omnium. We are once again using the popular and technical criterium course near downtown Rolla. The road race will be the extended Hellbender loop which will serve this year as the state championship road race.
course: The criterium is a  challenging closed course located near downtown Rolla at the Rolla High School (37.949311, -91.7673391). The course is a 0.6 mile counter-clockwise loop; predominately flat to rolling with minor elevation change. There are six 90-degree turns, two of them off camber and an uphill finish. More course information can be found at http://rollamultisportclub.org/
registration:
Registration: https://www.usacycling.org/register/2013-2206
Online registration closes midnight CST on May 28, 2013
•	CRITERIUM - Race day registration opens at 8:00AM at Race Headquarters and will remain open until 30 min prior to each start. 
•	All participants must check-in at the registration table. Participants will be issued their race number at registration.


•	ROAD RACE - Race day registration opens at 8:00AM at Race Headquarters and will remain open until 30 min prior to each start. 
•	ALL participants must check-in at the registration table. Participants will be issued their race number at registration
notes:
•	Entry fee includes USAC insurance and MOBRA fee. Non-licensed riders must purchase a USAC one-day license.
•	Free post-race showers courtesy of the Rolla Recreation Centre (1200 N. Holloway Street, 37.953061,-91.759368) – drive home clean!
•	No refunds. There is no rain date. All schedules except date and first race start time are subject to change.
•	Race is held under USA Cycling Event Permit. Only the above listed races are permitted and sanctioned by USA Cycling. No other races or activities at the event are sanctioned by USA Cycling.
•	Awards ceremony will occur at race headquarters 15min after standings are official for each category. If you are not present for your awards ceremony, prize money will be mailed to you the address you supply at registration but any non-cash prize or medals will be forfeited. 
•	There is a fee of $20.00 to register for a second criterium.
directions: Take I-44 Exit #186 to North Walnut Street. From I-44 eastbound, simply go straight through the stoplight at the top the Exit #186 ramp. From I-44 westbound, turn left off the ramp, cross over I-44, and turn left onto N Walnut at the stoplight. Bear left on N Walnut St to cross the railroad tracks on East 18th Street. Turn right onto Holloway Street. Turn right onto 10th Street at stoplight. Turn left onto Cedar Street immediately after passing Rolla High School. Race Headquarters is in the Rolla High School parking lot on the left. NOTE THAT THE CRITERIUM IS PART OF ROLLA’S SUMMERFEST CELEBRATION. MANY ROADS IN DOWNTOWN ROLLA WILL BE CLOSED ON JUNE 1, SO OTHER APPROACHES TO RACE HEADQUARTERS MAY NOT BE OPEN.

title: Tour Of Kansas City
description: Tour Of Kansas City is a three day long criterium series.
course: Friday night will be a the most difficult, saturday will be the most turns but prety flat and sunday will be a short flat circular course.
registration:
Preregistration is recommended.  For those registering same day, onsite
registration opens one hour before the first event and closes for each
category 15 minutes before the race time indicated on the flyer.

title: Springfield Criterium Presented by A&B Cycle
Busted Chain Womens Mountain Bike Clinic
description:
St Louis's first weekend long women's only mountain biking clinic!

Gain confidence and learn new skills in a safe, positive, and fun environment.  No matter your skill level, there will be a group perfect for you.  You choose what level you'd like to ride at, so you can improve as much as you want, but not feel overwhelmed or scared as hell!

It's not just riding either, there will also be yoga and evening sit-down clinics.  Check out all the awesome events going on over the weekend and we'll see you August 24th!
course: Located in southwestern St. Charles County, Klondike Park is a 250-acre park, acquired by the County in 1999.  There is a surprisingly wide range of trails in this park for a rather small area.  The trails on the western side are rockier and more technical, featuring a flowy, curvy trail, and the advanced, uber-technical trail. On the eastern side, one trail will take you on a thrilling ride beginning on top of the bluffs, and sending you rapidly down a screaming descent with super-tight switchbacks, a 40 ft. sandstone ledge, exposed slopes and even some short but tough climbing near the bottom.  Additionally, some technical skill structures have been added to the park including wooden skinnies, two teeters, and 2 drops.
registration: Thanks to our generous sponsors, registration is only $75.  This includes 2 full days of on the trail coaching, instructed yoga sessions, evening maintenance clinics, camping, 5 meals, giveaways, and more.  Spots are limited so register now!
notes: In order to register for the event, a USA Cycling license is required.  If you don't already have one, you can purchase a one-day, non-competitive license for $5.  The price of the clinic was dropped in order to absorb this cost.  If you already have a license....well, you got a little bit of a discount!
directions: From St Louis, take 64 west toward the town of Weldon Springs.  Take exit 10 for MO-94 S and in 13.6 miles, the entrance to Klondike park will be on your left.

title: 2013 Mizzou Cycling Mountain Madness
description:
Mountain biking returns to mizzou for yet another year!  Be sure to come out for another awesome race weekend!
Any questions please contact Kyle Nelson (815-218-5065) or Kevin Bonney (314-780-9056)
course:
XC
The XC race is at Cosmopolitan Park, just north of campus. The trail is a compact 4.8 mile 
loop with shorter but steep uphills and downhills. While the trail is smooth and mostly nice 
dirt with a few rocks, the twists, turns and at times narrow trail offers a handling challenge.

DH
Downhill at Mizzou returns with similar gnar, jumps n rocks, and more wishing we lived in 
Colorado. Full faces required.

STXC
Short track runs laps on a similar course as last year with a few changes and a little more 
length. Expect a mix of grass, gravel and singletrack. Oh, and did we mention a drop?

DS
Dual salmoning continues on a similar course as 2012 with some reworked sections.
registration: Registration is available both online and onsite.  Save yourself $5.00 per race and register online!
notes: One day licenses will be available onsite.  Lodging may be tight as there is a football game that weekend.   If looking for a place to stay please contact Kyle Nelson (815-218-5065) or Kevin Bonney (314-780-9056)
directions:
XC
Directions - From I-70: exit 124, head west through the roundabout on Business Loop 70 
and follow about 1 mile to park entrance. Race is on north side by skatepark. Look for signs.

DH
Directions: From I-70: exit 128A, head south on US-63 until you reach the Stadium Exit. Head West
 on Stadium until you hit Ashland Rd. Turn Right on Ashland then turn right on E. Campus Dr. 
 continue on East Park Loop Rd. 
GPS Coordinates: 38.937589,-92.313715 (East Park Loop)

STXC
Directions: From I-70: exit 128A, head south on US-63 until you reach the Stadium Exit. Head West
 on Stadium until you hit Ashland Rd. Turn Right on Ashland then turn right on E. Campus Dr. 
 continue on East Park Loop Rd. 
GPS Coordinates: 38.937589,-92.313715 (East Park Loop)

DS
Directions: From I-70: exit 128A, head south on US-63 until you reach the Stadium Exit. Head West
 on Stadium until you hit Ashland Rd. Turn Right on Ashland then turn right on E. Campus Dr. 
 continue on East Park Loop Rd. 
GPS Coordinates: 38.937589,-92.313715 (East Park Loop)
